title: What are some examples of formal words? - Quora

response.answer_text: I assume these are words we would not be likely to use in informal speech or writing, except, perhaps, for effect. Here are a few of mine: Albeit Heretofore Inasmuch Felicity Sagacity Epiphenomena Excoriate(d) And thousands of others Soooo….slightly archaic, tending toward Latin or French or German*, more likely to be found in legislation or contracts. But the stark truth is that I love to use formal words in informal conversation, solely with friends who appreciate that sort of thing, of course. If I had one. JK. *Or Greek or Sanskrit, come to think of it.

In English I tend to think it is using Latinate words - and I think there is a cross-over into pomposity but sometimes it is extremely useful. Mendacity doesn’t quite mean exactly the same as lying but because most people don’t know what it means, you can accuse people, especially important people like the UK Cabinet Secretary, Sir Jeremy Heywood, as I have done with full justification, of mendacity and, I hope, not seem to be petty and spiteful, but measured, sensible and appropriate. Likewise you can accuse politicians of circumlocution when what everyone knows you mean is that they won’t face the truth and state it as it is. You can see how that spills over into pomposity - but sometimes that isn’t a bad thing.
